meanings.sent1: The queen kinged her son, making him the ruler of the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The council kinged the nobleman, crowning him as the new monarch.
meanings.sent3: The magician kinged a frog, turning it into a majestic ruler of the pond.
meanings.sent4: With a wave of her wand, the fairy kinged the humble farmer, granting him a kingdom of his own.
meanings.sent5: In the ancient legend, the sword kinged the worthy warrior, bestowing upon him the crown of leadership.

meanings.sent1: After years of training, the young prince was finally kinged and took his place on the throne.
meanings.sent2: In the fairy tale, the poor orphan was unexpectedly kinged and became the ruler of the land.
meanings.sent3: The cat dreamt of being kinged and ruling over all the mice in the house.
meanings.sent4: The magical amulet kinged the chosen one, fulfilling the ancient prophecy.
meanings.sent5: The crown magically kinged the rightful heir, marking the beginning of a new era.

meanings.definition: Having the status or power of a king.
meanings.sent1: The kinged knight rode proudly through the kingdom, displaying his noble status.
meanings.sent2: The kinged ruler made wise decisions for his people, showing his kingly power.
meanings.sent3: The kinged cat lounged on the velvet cushion, enjoying its regal position in the household.
meanings.sent4: The kinged lion roared with authority, asserting its dominance over the savannah.
meanings.sent5: The kinged queen graciously welcomed foreign dignitaries, embodying royal elegance and grace.
